titlestmt.titleproper: Carrel (Alexis) and Lindbergh (Charles) papers, Theodore Malinin collection
A Guide to the Theodore Malinin collection of Alexis Carrel and Charles Lindbergh papers FA208

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-11-01 01:33:52 -0400.

did.unittitle: Theodore Malinin collection of Alexis Carrel and Charles Lindbergh papers

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Theodore I. Malinin (1933- ) was a physician and professor of orthopedics and rehabilitation at the University of Miami's School of Medicine since 1969. He is best known in the medical community for his work on the science of preservation in regards to donated bone and tissues, and for his direction of the University of Miami Tissue Bank which he founded in 1970. Motivated by an article in Science magazine about the forgotten contributions of Dr. Alexis Carrel to the surgical field, Malinin set forth on a path of research that eventually culminated in 1979 with the publishing of Malinin's Surgery and Life: The Extraordinary Career of Alexis Carrel.

Alexis Carrel, born in France in 1873 joined the staff of the Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research (RIMR) in 1906 where he remained until his retirement in 1939. Winner of the Nobel Prize in Physiology and Medicine in 1912 for his work on vascular suturing, Carrel focused much of his research at RIMR on the study of tissue culture and organ transplantation. After retirement Carrel returned to France where he died in 1944.

Malinin acquired most materials in this collection whilst compiling information for Surgery and Life. The materials were acquired from the Alexis Carrel Collection at Georgetown University, as well as friends and colleagues of Carrel, such as Charles A. Lindbergh (with whom Carrel developed the perfusion pump). The collection includes material on Carrel as well as his work with Lindbergh and other colleagues at RIMR, and Malinin's papers on Carrel.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection is one of the Rockefeller University Special Collections.
Includes Malinin's book on Carrel, as well as books that were either formally Carrel's or mentioned Carrel, that have been removed from the collection and can be found in the library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical and chronological order.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Copies of documents collected from other archives cannot be photocopied.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted pending permission from Rockefeller University.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Alexis Carrel papers collection is available at Georgetown University, Special Collections. Please consult an archivist for an inventory of the holdings at Georgetown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of records include: biographical material, notebooks, and reprints.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes biographical information related to Alexis Carrel as well as recollections of Carrel and his work as written by friends, colleagues and others; bibliographical information of Carrel's published works; newspaper and magazine clippings related to Carrel's published works and research; and obituaries of Carrel in both French and English.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Broken into subgroups: Annual Reports; Correspondence; Man, the Unknown; and Manuscripts. The first subgroup contains annual reports of Carrel and his colleagues while at RIMR. The correspondence contains letters, telegrams, receipts, pamphlets, and other materials that were sent to Carrel from family, friends, colleagues and others, as well as letters sent from Carrel.

Includes both original letters and xeroxed copies. Man, the Unknown contains newspaper clippings and publicity announcements about Carrel's book by that title, as well as correspondence to and from Carrel about the book. Within the manuscript subgroup are both published and unpublished manuscripts by Carrel.
Includes both originals and xeroxed or retyped copies of the manuscripts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains charts, graphs, tables, drawings and notes. Experiments related mostly to tissue culture studies particularly related to Sarcoma and fibroblasts. Also contains some of the experiments completed by Carrel's colleagues and associates, most notably Dr. Ebeling. Materials related to the Mousery at the RIMR also included.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hardbound volumes containing notes and charts. Related to animal experiments and tissue culture experiments completed between 1925 and 1935. Also includes Volumes 7-13 of the notebooks referring to Carrel's experimental work with Charles Lindbergh.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains copies of Carrel correspondence, excerpts of letters from Carrel, obituaries, memoir materials on Carrel and Lindbergh, publications, listings of materials in the Carrel Collection at Georgetown University, reprints, unpublished manuscripts of Carrel, a bibliography of Carrel's works, notes and book outlines compiled by Malinin for his book on Carrel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains both black and white and color projection slides. The Carrel slides are replicas of glass negatives related to Carrel's work during WWI in France and the development of the Carrel-Dakin Solution. They also contain slides related to vascular suturing as well as personal slides of Carrel, his wife and their home in France. The Malinin slides relate to presentation material regarding Carrel and his work with Charles Lindbergh on a perfusion pump.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical order by individual.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains reprints of both Carrel and colleagues and associates with whom he worked over the years. There are also miscellaneous reprints.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The Carrel reprints are arranged in alphabetical order, whilst the reprints of his colleagues are arranged in chronological order.
